column1: sliding in with the arm, Watson wears it on the pad as he misses the attempted flick
on a length, spinning away outside off, defended with bat close to pad
good length, comes forward and turns it away to square leg for one
short of a length, tucked off the backfoot to square leg
sliding on leg, defended down the pitch
chopped on! Early breakthrough for Punjab. Shortish ball but not much spin and too close to the stumps to be attempting a cut. Gets an inside edge for his troubles
fullish, on middle and off, defended
holding its line in the channel outside off, left alone
steps down the track but it is angled into him. Short of a length, and gets cramped for room, misses and the ball just misses leg stump
short of a length, moving back in, gets an inside edge to the pad to square leg
deft. Sees some width on offer outside off and just open the face of his bat. Beats a diving point to his right as well as the fielder in the deep who runs across but can't get down in time
short of good length, outside off, not much bounce, swing and a miss from the batsman
on a length, defended from outside off to the left of the bowler
shortish, outside off. Pulls hard. It does not bounce as much as he may have liked. Thumps it hard and just clears the leaping Maxwell at lid-on
fullish, on middle, quietly comes forward and dabs it between mid-on and midwicket for a single
short, pushes him back, de Villiers gets on top of the bounce and defends into the off side
full, outside off, driven crisply but straight to mid-off
that's as flat a six as you'd ever see. Full, in the slot outside off and giving him the room to open his shoulders. De Villiers gleefully thumps it over extra cover and it goes all the way
god length, on off, comes forward and step and defends

short of a length, slightly sliding into him, so he backs away to make room and drops it in front of covers. Takes off for a non-existent single and is sent back by de Villiers, direct hit and he could have been gone

goes for a pull but there was really no room to play that shot. Shortish, so it wasn't so much about the length. Though he backs away, he cannot manufacture enough room and gets a top-edge that goes straight down the throat of long-on. Mid-on had dropped back unlike in the previous over
fuller, outside off, comes forward and pushes into covers for one
full, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
beaten. Full, cuts back in slightly, prods without moving his feet and the ball misses the inside edge, and off-stump, by a whisker
shortish but not short enough, attempts a cut and chops it hard into the ground
fullish length, on the stumps, defended with the straightest of bats
tucked off the pads to the left of deep midwicket for one
sees some width on offer and pokes his bat without getting close to it, gets an inside edge and they steal the single by the time the bowler can there on the follow-through
short of a length, outside off, punched on the up off the backfoot to the left of mid-off where Amla runs across and tumbles right on the practice wicket as he gathers it

back of a length, angling in, rapped on the pads as it misses the flick. It seems as though height may have been an issue but the umpire C Shamshuddin does not think so. That is a close one. He was struck pretty high on the pad and was jumping up as well. But Jadhav is not a very tall man. Still pretty close, though
good length, outside off, gets a good stride across and defends back to the bowler
beautiful. On a length and tempts him by firing it just outside off. Gets it to seam away and beat the outside edge
length, angling in, closes the face of his bat a tad early and gets a mild leading edge back towards the bowler
good length, comes on straight and on the stumps, defended
tucked with the angle to midwicket. There is a fielder there, so no run. Good, testing over from Sandeep
back of a length, angling in, rides the bounce and turns it away through square leg
fullish, just around off, comes forward and defends with bat close to pad into the off side
good length, on off, defended to point off the front foot
short, some width on offer outside off, hangs back and flays it hard but cannot beat square third man running to his right
short of a length, outside off, gets on top of the bounce and punches off the backfoot to sweeper cover
full, clipped off the pads and beats midwicket diving to his right. That's loose bowling
back of a length, gets on top of the bounce and defends back to the bowler

advances down the track and the bowler takes it away from him. Short of a length and he fetches a pull away from the body. The ball goes to Amla at midwicket and Mandeep takes off for a suicidal single. He is sent back and has to put in the dive
short of good length, gets on top of it and defends
slightly back of a length, punched hard off the backfoot to the right of sweeper cover for a brace
full, on off, defended watchfully to point
back of a length, just outside off, punched off the backfoot and Stoinis at extra cover makes a diving save
short of a length, angled across to Mandeep who is pushed back and opens the face of his bat to point
short of a length and angling away, pace off that delivery and beats the pull
back of a length, pitching on leg, tries to flick and closes the face of his bat a tad early. Lobs it to square leg. The fielder is slightly backward. That was the off-cutter
short of a length, down the leg side, de Villiers tries to tuck off the pads and misses
full, on off, de Villiers bends forward and drives it down to long-off

shot, what a shot! That's a monster hit. Short and sitting up nicely for Mandeep who has all the time to rock back and swivel around with the pull. The ball goes over backward square and smacks the roof

overcompensates with the length. Fires it too full and too wide. The intent is right, making the batsman reach out. Mandeep does so as he tries to drive but the cordon is vacant and the outside edge runs away to third man
back of a length, angling in, tucked off the hips towards fine leg and the wicketkeeper runs across to pick it up
short of a length, angling in, inside-edges to the pad and takes off for a quick single as the ball goes to the right of the keeper
back of a length and coming in, tucked with the angle to the left of deep backward square leg for a brace
short of good length, whipped away to mid-on who is slightly deep and wide
fullish, sliding on leg, turned away to midwicket for a quick single
on a length, slightly seaming away. De Villiers was looking to flick across the line and gets beaten. Close
short and wide, punched off the backfoot and beats point. Takes on the fielder in the deep and the throw is on the bounce and they make it back easily
gets forward and drops it in between cover and point for one
comes in with the arm, no turn, de Villiers finds an inside to the pad as he tries to tuck it away
trying to cramp de Villiers again but he backs away and manages to tuck it away of the middle of the bat
short on middle, gets his body behind the ball and swats it hard to Varun Aaron at deep square leg
tucked away to deep square for one
short of a length, angling in, tucked away to deep backward square leg. Thinks of a second but decides against it
back of a length on middle, backs away and opens his bat face to steer it to deep backward point
back of a length, outside off, drops it into the off side with soft hands for a quick single
backs away and the bowler follows him, opens his bat face, more of the outside part of the bat, actually as he knocks it behind square on the off side
back of a length, outside off, punched to mid-off for one
runs in zig-zag and fires it from wide of the crease, short of a length, gets on top of the bounce and runs it down to third man
fullish, pushed back to the bowler
width on offer, chases it away from the body and flays it out to sweeper cover
short of a length, backs away and punches it down to long-off
punched off the backfoot in front of point. Takes off for a single but is forced to go back. Close
short and wide, slapped hard but can't beat point
shortish again, outside off, punched out to sweeper cover

great catch by Saha. That is one of the best catches I have seen recently. Short ball, Mandeep tries to pull and gets a top-edge. Saha has to dart back all the way, almost runs three-fourths towards the boundary and in the last minute, he has to change direction, dives to his right, towards fine leg and takes it with both hands
short, wide, cut hard to covers
pushes forward and knocks it to square third man off the outside part of the bat
fuller on off, opens the bat face and defends to point. No run there
short of a length, outside off, tries to open his bat face and gets an inside edge that misses the stumps and Saha dives to his left to stop it. Another great effort
full, on the pads, turns it away to deep backward square leg for one
comes down the track, it is sliding in with the arm. He misses the flick and the keeper takes it off the pad. No inside-edge there
plays it off the front foot to the right of the bowler. Decides against the single
short of a length, punched crisply off the backfoot to mid-off
back of a length, on middle and leg, whipped away from the crease between mid-on and midwicket
full, outside off, drives away from the body and gets an inside edge back to the bowler
beats him with pace, 143kph, beats him on the pull. Stifled appeal for caught-behind but there was no under-edge, that clipped the back thigh
short of a length, gets on top of the bounce and opens the face of his bat to run it down to square third man for one
full, outside off, de Villiers backs away to give himself room and lofts it over mid-off. Clean and straight over the boundary
turned away to deep midwicket. Two fielders converge and they keep it to one
tries to cut but it is not short enough and does not get up as much as he would have liked it to, beaten
short of a length, walks across and tries to flick across the line, gets hit high on the pad. Given as runs, so there was an inside-edge there
back of a length, angling in, tucked off the pads to deep fine leg for one
short of a length, closes the bat face early as he looks to flick and gets a leading edge back to the bowler. Think it was the off-cutter
what a shot! Thumps it muscularly over deep midwicket. On a length, on off, de Villiers smacks it bang off the middle of the bat
shortish, gets on top of it and whips it away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, tries to back away and pull off the hips, gets it just to the left of backward square leg who scampers across and stops it
short ball, de Villiers lets it go after coming down the track. Called a wide and square leg umpire Anil Chaudhary signals a wide and one for the over
and the extra ball proves costly. This one's short and de Villiers lays into a pull shot, into the second-tier after it clears deep midwicket. Fifty for de Villiers
That is humongous. Binny this time. Fullish, seam-up on the stumps, Binny swings hard and lofts it over cow corner
that has been bludgeoned through extra cover. Overpitched, outside off, can't be bowling a half-volley at this stage of the innings. Binny crashes it off the front foot
attempts a yorker and offersup a low full toss on middle and leg, punched hard to the right of long-on but Miller runs across in a flash and gets down neatly to stop it clean
short ball, does not really get on top of it but pulls anyway. Two fielders converge in front of the deep midwicket boundary but the ball bounces in front of them
another yorker gone wrong. Full toss again, comes on at a nice height and de Villiers shovels it between wide long-on and deep midwicket. Flat six, that's just brute force
well-done. Full ball but slower from Mohit. De Villiers swings hard but too early and misses
drives hard away from the body, gives too much power and gets an outside edge that files towards third man. But there is a fielder there and he gets around it
how's that for placement. Wide outside off and he just opens the face of his bat to guide it wide of backward point. That was nearly a yorker but such is the class of this batsman

first, there was one that smacked the roof. Now, one has sailed over it and out of the stadium. Biggest hit of the night. Walks across to this low full toss outside off and swings for the fences. Makes meaty connection, bang off the middle and out of here

another full toss and it is dispatched. If he wants to bowl the yorker, he better get it right. De Villiers thumps it over deep midwicket. Not as big enough this time but it goes well into the crowd nonetheless
and now he drags the length back. Tries to take it away from the batsman but drifts away a tad more than he would have liked. De Villiers reaches out but cannot make contact
fullish length, holding its line outside off, de Villiers swings mighty hard and does not make contact
on a length, whipped away to deep midwicket for one. Swung hard but did not find the middle of the bat. He gets to keep strike for the last over, though
slower full ball, finds the inside edge of de Villiers and Saha dives to his left. They get de Villiers off strike
short, caught in two minds is Binny. Wants to pull but the bounce is considerable and goes for a late upper-cut. Cannot make contact
full, outside off, thumps it hard and drags it from outside off to long-on. Strike back with AB
fullish, outside off, de Villiers throws his hands at it and gets a bottom edge back to the bowler. Nice bowling from Mohit, taking it away from the batsman

slower full ball, outside off, de Villiers comes charging down and lofts it over long-off. He had to make a late adjustment there. Came down the track, saw it was wider and then had to move across slightly to reach out

one more that sails over the roof. De Villiers anticipates that the bowler would take it away from him, so he walks across early. Gets right on top of it and smashes it over deep square leg. That was all timing and balance
great ball. Angles in at the corridor, back of a length, swings away late and beats the outside edge as it climbs
wide of the crease, back of a length at off stump, tapped wide of mid-on off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, Amla shuffles across, hops up in the air and whips it past square leg with the angle
back of a length outside off, nips back in and slices open a gap between chest and inside edge as it beats him
full and swinging away from outside off, no feet from Amla as he pokes at this, gets the inside half of the bat and it rolls into the leg side
wide of the crease, good length, in the corridor, late movement away but left alone on height

good length, angled into the pads, and he flicks this expertly to get it past square leg. Great timing and Binny has to hustle across and put in a dive to his right at deep midwicket. Does it nicely too
tossed up outside off, puts in a short stride, knows he can't get to the pitch so extends the arms and lifts it over the infield on the off side. Good shot. Safe shot.
good length at leg stump, pushed into the midwicket  area off the back foot
floated full at leg stump, dips on him and makes him drive uppishly to mid-on
good length at leg stump, turned square into the leg side with soft hands off the front foot
good length, angled in at the pads, flicked straight to square leg
back of a length, angled down leg side, flies past his hip
good length, angled in at the thigh guard, tapped into the leg side with soft hands
back of a length at off stump, nicely behind the line as he drops this into the off side off the back foot

he's all tangled up, but he gets a six. They don't call it the batsman's game for no reason. Stanlake is wide of the crease, bowls back of a length at off stump, Vohra is expecting this to fly past his face, takes his eyes off, then decides to go for a pull. Gets a top edge that flies over the slips and the boundary too
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length, angled in at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the inside edge
back of a length at middle stump, holds his shape this time for the pull, and keeps his eyes on the ball. But doesn't connect nicely enough. In the end, it's a chip in the direction of long leg
back of a length in the corridor, not too much room, but the pace is slow enough for him to adjust his wrists and squeeze this on the up, over point
good length at off stump, he's gone on the up again, this time with a short stride and over mid-off
full and angled in at middle stump, leans into it and flicks it past square leg
back of a length, in the corridor, on top of the bounce and dabbed down to third man
full and angled into the pads, stands tall and tickles this past short fine leg
full at leg stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
full outside off, too close to execute the drive, taps it into the covers region
good length at off stump, watches it closely and drops it in front of point to steal a run
shooooooot. Vintage Amla. Good length outside off stump, full flourish with the backlift and then he drops the axe on this ball when it comes close to him. One bounce, past the cover point fielder
short and wide outside off, shuffles across and tries to ride the bounce and lift this over the slips, beaten
back of a length in the corridor, off the ground again as he whips this to deep square leg
good length, angled in at leg stump, whipped to deep square and that's the fifty partnership
back of a length at off stump, opens the face and drops it into the gully region

dropped. Stanlake puts down a simple catch. He's six-foot-three-hundred, is Stanlake. He's the man you want at fine leg. Not this time. It's a bouncer outside off stump, Amla shuffles across and hooks uppishly. Straight to Stanlake at fine leg. It's right in front of his eyes, and bursts through his hands
back of a length at leg stump, cops it on the thigh guard after shuffling across
glorious. Full and in at middle stump, stands tall, full balance, full face of the bat - punched past Amla
short and wide outside off, tries to lift this over the slip, beaten

plumb. in. front. This is full and angled in at middle stump. He's been hitting through the line all innings long, but is undone the first time he gets a slower ball. Closes the face too early, through the shot too early, struck in front of middle stump
tossed up full at leg stump, driven firmly past his partner and long-on has to scramble across quickly on this small ground, slides to his left and cuts it off. Abdulla there
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length at off stump, chopped straight to point off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, goes on the back foot and punches this past extra cover, but AB is across quickly to his left at long-off
flighted full at off stump, driven sweetly to long-off
good length at off stump, this is a straighter one. Amla is deep in the crease and he taps it to long-on's right off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, back foot punch, straight to sweeper
good length at off stump, squeezes it to extra cover off the back foot
good length, leg stump, goes back and punches it to long-on
good length, fired down the leg side
full at leg stump, clipped off his toes to deep midwicket
bowls the wristspinner again. Drops it short outside leg stump, this is slow and meek. Axar is not. Quickly latches on to it and pulls it over the midwicket boundary
full at off stump, driven to long-off

plays around a googly. This wrong'un is flat, and it's full at middle stump. Axar is looking at clearing midwicket once more, but this is too close and too quick and through his slog to shatter the stumps
full at off stump, goes forward and opens the face to squeeze it to sweeper cover
drifted in at middle stump, he's not to the pitch and gets a leading edge back to the bowler as he closes the face of the bat
corrects himself the very next ball. This is also full and drifting into him, but this time he gets the front leg out of the way and hits with the spin, straight over the bowler
yorker length outside off, chops it to Stanlake at short third man who gets down awkwardly but holds on
good length at off stump, tapped to extra cover off the front foot

good length, angled in at off stump. Maxwell shuffles across to work it into the leg side, misses it, takes it on the pads, but he had gotten outside the line of the stumps and scrambles through for a single as the ball runs into the gully region
slower ball, good length at off stump, shuffles across, waits for it and turns it down to fine leg
good length at off stump, backs away and clobbers this on the up. Well, he would have, except it's right off the toe of the bat. Over the bowler and a couple of bounces into the boundary
slower bouncer outside off, walks across to pull, but its too slow and hits him in the bicep

oh dear. Maniacal shot. This is full and just outside off stump. Maxwell is making room, then comes back close to it, then adjusts to stay leg side of it anyway, then contorts his wrists to slice it over sweeper cover
good length outside off, slower ball, backs away, taps it to point
good length, flat at leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
flat, fired in at the pads, hits the front one too, but outside leg stump
full at leg stump, clears the front leg and drives it to long-on
back of a length at off stump, hangs back and punches to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, loops on Maxwell as he gives the charge and he isn't to the pitch. Drags it wide of long-on off the inside half
classy shot. Tossed up at leg stump, small stride to get to the pitch, full face of the bat and lifted nicely over long-on

dropped. Full and wide outside off stump, gets low and slices it. Can't clear Abdulla at point, but he doesn't hold on. Hands in front of the face, ball bursts through, not unlike Stanlake's drop. Correction: it was Mandeep
good length at off stump, tucked to deep square leg
slower ball, back of a length at leg stump, shuffles across to whip it fine, but can't connect. Thuds into his thigh guard and lobs in front of the keeper
short and down the leg side, swivels and keeps the pull down, gets it fine and brings up his fifty
good length at off stump, shuffles across and glances it to deep square
good length outside off, stands tall and spanks it on the up, over extra cover
full and angled in at leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
full and floated at leg stump, watches it till its under his eyes and places it between deep midwicket and long-on
good length at off stump, thumps this off the back foot, one bounce to long-on
good length, angled in at middle stump, walks across the stump and dabs it to long leg
back of a length at off stump, makes room and cuts straight to backward point
arm ball, good length, slides into the front pad and hits it as he can't connect with the pull shot
short and outside off stump, backs away, throws his arms at it and opens the face enough to lift it over third man
slower ball, short outside off stump, backs away, goes for the cut again but this time he toe-ends it to mid-off
back of a length in the corridor, rides the bounce, dabs it to third man
back of a length outside off, hops inside the line at the last moment and whips it to fine leg on the bounce
slower ball, full at off stump, shuffles across, pushes it to midwicket
too easy. Back of a length outside off stump, makes room, chops it flat over point and the ground size is optimal to pick up six
low full toss at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
watches him make room, tosses it wide outside off stump and beats his heave
good length, looped outside off stump, Maxwell hasn't moved down the leg side this time. Stays put, waits for it and hammers it flat past long-off
